corruptus: <entryFree id="n11321" type="main" key="corruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corruptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from corrumpo.</entryFree>
corruspor: <entryFree id="n11322" type="hapax" key="corruspor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cor-ruspor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conr-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n11322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to search carefully after</hi>, = conquiro, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=62" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 62</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cors: <entryFree id="n11323" type="main" key="cors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cors</orth>, <itype>cortis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. cohors.</entryFree>
corsae: <entryFree id="n11324" type="greek" key="corsae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/rsai</foreign>; <sense id="n11324.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in arch.,</quote> <trans><tr>the outer strip in the moulding about a door, a girder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6, 3 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
corsica: <entryFree id="n11325" type="main" key="Corsi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corsĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Corsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 470</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> (among the Greeks, <foreign lang="greek">*ku/rnos, *korsi/s</foreign>), <sense id="n11325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the island Corsica, in the Mediterranean Sea, renowned in ancient times for the honey and wax of wild bees; the place of banishment of Seneca the philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 80</bibl>; Monum. Scip. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:52 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 52 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11325.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11325.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cor-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Corsican</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:194" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 194</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Corsicans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 7, 1</bibl> and 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 38, § 126</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Also,</quote> <trans><tr>a people that migrated from Corsica into northern Sardinia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11325.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corsĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Corsican</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 84</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11325.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corsĭcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Corsican</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 9, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corsoides: <entryFree id="n11326" type="greek" key="corso^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corsŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">korsoeidh/s</foreign> (hairlike), <sense id="n11326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corsus: <entryFree id="n11327" type="main" key="Corsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Corsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Corsica, II. A.</entryFree>
cortex: <entryFree id="n11328" type="main" key="cortex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and rar. <gen>f.</gen> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 35</bibl>) [Sanscr. kart, to cut, split; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kei/rw</foreign>; cf. culter], <sense id="n11328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bark, rind, shell, hull.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11328.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">obducuntur libro aut cortice trunci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n11328.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n11328.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 199, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 742</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 554</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:649" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 649</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:226 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 226 al.</bibl>; cf. infra.—</sense><sense id="n11328.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 512</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 630</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:209" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 60" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11328.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the bark of the cork-tree, cork</hi>, used for stoppers, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 120</bibl>; (<hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 10</bibl>; in learning to swim; <cit><quote lang="la">hence prov.: nare sine cortice,</quote> <trans><tr>to need no more assistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 120</bibl></cit>—From its lightness is borrowed the phrase: <cit><quote lang="la">tu levior cortice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut summā cortex levis innatet undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11328.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">other shells</hi> than those of vegetables: <cit><quote lang="la">ovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11328.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the outward part, covering</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the body</hi>: anima corporeum corticem reliquit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 199, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corticatus: <entryFree id="n11329" type="main" key="corti^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cortex</etym>, <sense id="n11329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with a bark</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pars (sarmenti),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <trans><tr>resin taken from a tree with a portion of the bark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corticeus: <entryFree id="n11330" type="main" key="corti^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of bark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:16" default="NO">3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 21, 24, § 71</bibl> (cortice, Sillig); <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 246 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
corticosus: <entryFree id="n11331" type="main" key="corti^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in bark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 19, 78, § 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corticulus: <entryFree id="n11332" type="main" key="corti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thin rind, bark</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:10:12:50:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 10, 12, 50, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cortina: <entryFree id="n11333" type="main" key="corti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a round vessel, a kettle, caldron</hi> (for cooking, liquids, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 22 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:191" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 26, 65, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11333.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the tripod of Apollo, in the form of a caldron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 347</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 635</bibl>.—Hence, also, <hi rend="ital">a tripod</hi> as a sacred offering, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11333.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">any thing caldron-shaped, an arch, a circle</hi> (very rare); <hi rend="ital">the cault of heaven</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 48</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (Ann. v. 9 Vahl.); <hi rend="ital">the circle of a theatre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 295</bibl>; and prob. also <hi rend="ital">a circle of hearers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl> <cb n="CORV" /> dub. (v. Andresen in h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n11333.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A curtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem cortinae de bysso retortā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cortinale: <entryFree id="n11334" type="hapax" key="corti_na_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortīnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cortina</etym>, <sense id="n11334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the caldron-room, the place where new wine was boiled down in the</hi> cortina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cortinipotens: <entryFree id="n11335" type="hapax" key="Corti_ni^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cortīnĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">powerful on the tripod</hi>, an epithet of Apollo, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cortinula: <entryFree id="n11336" type="hapax" key="corti_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortīnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small kettle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 31</bibl> dub. (v. Wagner ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
cortona: <entryFree id="n11337" type="main" key="Corto_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cortōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town in Etruria, northwest of Lake Trasimenus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 4, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11337.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cortōnen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cortona</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cortōnenses</orth>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cortumio: <entryFree id="n11338" type="gloss" key="cortumio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cortumio</orth>, an old word of the augurial lang., perh. equiv. to contumio, from contueor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
cortuosa: <entryFree id="n11339" type="main" key="Cortuosa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cortuosa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cortynia: <entryFree id="n11340" type="main" key="Corty_nia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cortȳnia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Gort-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl>; cf. Gortyna.</sense></entryFree>
corulus: <entryFree id="n11341" type="main" key="co^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. corylus.</entryFree>
coruncanius: <entryFree id="n11342" type="main" key="Co^runca_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏruncānĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n11342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman plebeian</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 21:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 114, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corus: <entryFree id="n11343" type="main" key="co_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. caurus.</entryFree>
coruscamen: <entryFree id="n11344" type="main" key="co^rusca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏruscāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>corusco</etym>, <sense id="n11344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glittering, a flash</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 226</bibl> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
coruscatio: <entryFree id="n11345" type="main" key="co^rusca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏruscātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glittering, a flash, coruscation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(margaritarum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Car. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coruscifer: <entryFree id="n11346" type="main" key="co^rusci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏruscĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coruscusfero</etym>, <sense id="n11346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightning-bearing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 808</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
corusco: <entryFree id="n11347" type="main" key="co^rusco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrusco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (the access. form conisco is found in some copies of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 320</bibl>, and Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 21</bibl>) [root scar-, to leap; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skai/rw</foreign>; cf. also <foreign lang="greek">koru/ssw</foreign>; v. Lidd. and Scott, s. v.]. <sense id="n11347.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">push with the horns</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">agni ludunt blandeque coruscant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:6" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 6</bibl></cit>: caput opponis cum eo coruscans, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11347.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to move quickly, to vibrate, shake, brandish, wave, tremble</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n11347.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo Gaesa manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 887</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:434" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 434</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:228 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 228 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguas (colubrae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternos apices (flammae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:432" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 432</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11347.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to flit, flutter, shake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes pennis coruscant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abies,</quote> <trans><tr>trembles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:254" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11347.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of the tremulous motion of fire, lightning, or brilliant bodies, <hi rend="ital">to flash, glitter, gleam, coruscate</hi>: flamma inter nubes coruscat, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elucent aliae (apes) et fulgore coruscant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:304" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telisque salum facibusque coruscat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:703" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coruscans clipeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 29 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
coruscus: <entryFree id="n11348" type="main" key="co^ruscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏruscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corusco, II.</etym> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). <sense id="n11348.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In waving motion, waving, vibrating, tremulous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 701</bibl></cit>.—Humorously: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia corusca prae tremore fabulor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>trembling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11348.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Flashing, gleaming, glittering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 296</bibl></cit>.—So of lightning: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 283</bibl></cit>.—Also: vis fulminis, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 234</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">radii (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 768</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri ferro auroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in Greek constr.: cristis capita alta corusci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 678</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11348.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)nqu/mhma</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏruscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">lightning</hi>, Venant. 3, 4.</sense></entryFree>
corvinus: <entryFree id="n11349" type="main" key="corvi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corvīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corvus</etym>, <sense id="n11349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the raven, raven-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 15, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigredo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 118, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11349.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Corvīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Valeria; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 20</bibl> Duker.</sense></entryFree>
corvus: <entryFree id="n11350" type="main" key="corvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root kar-, kal-, to sound; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">kale/w, ko/rac</foreign>, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n11350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raven</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:121 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 121 sq.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to the fable, orig. white, changed to a black bird in punishment for treachery,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:541 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 541 sq.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on account of its gift of prophecy (oscen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 11</bibl></cit>), consecrated to Apollo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5</bibl>, <cb n="CORY" /> 329 (hence, Phoebeïus ales, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:545" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 545</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphicus ales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 122</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:506" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 506</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">its flight to the right indicated good fortune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11350.1" n="B" level="2"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cruce corvos pascere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be hanged</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11350.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">bodies whose form or coloring is similar to that of the raven's bill</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11350.3" n="A" level="2"> In form. </sense><sense id="n11350.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A military implement, a grapnel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:24" default="NO">4, 3, 24</bibl> Mützell.—</sense><sense id="n11350.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A battering-ram</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11350.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A surgical instrument</hi>, in the form of a hook, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:19:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 19, § 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11350.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation Corvus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:39" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11350.8" n="B" level="2"> From its color, <hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11350.9" n="C" level="2"> In mal. part. = fellator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 63</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:74" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corybas: <entryFree id="n11351" type="main" key="Co^ry^bas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrybas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*koru/bas</foreign>. <sense id="n11351.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrybantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<number>sing.</number> Corybas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 148 al.</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*koru/bantes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the priests of Cybele, whose religious service consisted in noisy music and wild armed dances</hi>, later interchanged with Curetes (q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:210" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1877" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1877</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 474</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:70:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 70, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 208</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrybantĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of the Corybantes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11351.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Cybele, and father of the second Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coryceum: <entryFree id="n11352" type="greek" key="co_ry^ce_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōrycēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwrukei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n11352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place in the palæstra where the</hi> athletae <hi rend="ital">exercised themselves by striking a suspended sack filled with fig-grains, flour, sand</hi>, etc. (v. Lidd. and Scott, s. v. <foreign lang="greek">kw/rukos</foreign>, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11, 2</bibl>; cf. 1. corycus.</sense></entryFree>
corycius: <entryFree id="n11353" type="main" key="Co_ry^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōrycĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kwru/kios</foreign>, <sense id="n11353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Corycian</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11353.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Corycian mountain cave</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*kwru/kion a)/ntron</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">on Parnassus, famous in ancient fable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Co rycium nemus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Parnassian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:347" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11353.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōrycĭdes</orth> <itype>Nymphae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the daughters of Plistus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 320</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11353.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the promontory Corycus;</hi> v. 2. Corycus, II.</sense></entryFree>
corycomachia: <entryFree id="n11354" type="greek" key="co_ry^co^ma^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōrycŏmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwrukomaxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n11354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the exercise of the</hi> athletae <hi rend="ital">with the</hi> corycus (v. 1. corycus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:11:134" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 11, 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corycus: <entryFree id="n11355" type="greek" key="co_ry^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōrycus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cōrĭ-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kw/rukos</foreign>, <sense id="n11355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leathern sack filled with sand, flour</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">by means of which the</hi> athletae <hi rend="ital">exercised in the palæstra;</hi> only fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">corycus laterum et vocis meae Bestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl></cit> B. and K., Halm; cf. Klotz and Orell. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11356" type="main" key="Co_ry^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōrycus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kw/rukos</foreign>, <sense id="n11356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in Cilicia, with a town and harbor of the same name, and a cave, very celebrated in ancient times; also famous for its production of saffron;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Khorgos</hi>, Mel 1, 13, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corycus mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11356.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōry-cĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Corycian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 20, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, nimbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:39" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:214" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11356.2" n="III" level="1"> Corycus, <hi rend="ital">a promontory and harbor on the coast of Ionia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ko/raka</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 43, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11356.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Pamphylia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corydalus: <entryFree id="n11357" type="greek" key="co^ry^da^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrydălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">korudalo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the crested lark</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corydon: <entryFree id="n11358" type="main" key="Co^ry^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrydon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korudw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n11358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Greek proper name;</hi> of a shepherd, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 34, 73 al.</sense></entryFree>
corylenus: <entryFree id="n11359" type="main" key="Co^ry^le_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrylēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*korulhno/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Æolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coryletum: <entryFree id="n11360" type="hapax" key="co^ry^le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrylētum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrŭlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>corylus</etym>, <sense id="n11360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hazel-thicket, a copse of hazeltrees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:587" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 587</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corylus: <entryFree id="n11361" type="greek" key="co^ry^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrylus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/rulos</foreign>, <sense id="n11361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hazel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">filbert shrub</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:93 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 93 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
corymbia: <entryFree id="n11362" type="greek" key="co^ry^mbi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrymbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">korumbi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n11362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant ferula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 56, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corymbiatus: <entryFree id="n11363" type="main" key="co^rymbi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrymbĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corymbus</etym>, <sense id="n11363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">set round with clusters of ivy-berries, corymbiated</hi>: discus, Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corymbifer: <entryFree id="n11364" type="hapax" key="Co^rymbi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrymbĭfer</orth>, <itype>feri</itype>, <sense id="n11364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi> [corymbusfero],<pb n="476" /> <cb n="COS" />  <hi rend="ital">bearing clusters of ivy-berries</hi>, an epithet of Bacchus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:393" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 393</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corymbion: <entryFree id="n11365" type="greek" key="co^rymbi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrymbĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koru/mbion</foreign>, <sense id="n11365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hair curled in the form of clusters of ivy-berries</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 110, 1</bibl> and 5.</sense></entryFree>
corymbites: <entryFree id="n11366" type="greek" key="co^rymbi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrymbītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">korumbi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n11366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant</hi> tithymalus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 44, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corymbus: <entryFree id="n11367" type="greek" key="co^rymbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrymbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/rumbos</foreign>, <sense id="n11367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cluster of fruit, a cluster of flowers</hi> of different plants; so esp. freq. of <hi rend="ital">a cluster of ivyberries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 665</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 52</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for the crowning of Bacchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit> (3, 28), 39; 3 (4), 17, 29; <cit><quote lang="la">of Osiris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 56, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elaphobosci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:79 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 37, § 79 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11367.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11367.2" n="A" level="2"> Of carved clusters for the ornamenting of ships, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:273" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:691" default="NO">4, 691</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11367.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The nipple</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 20, 356</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11367.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An elevation of earth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corynaeus: <entryFree id="n11368" type="main" key="Co^ry^naeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrynaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of two Trojans, companions of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 228</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 571</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corypha: <entryFree id="n11369" type="main" key="Co^ry^pha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrypha</orth>, v. Coryphe.</entryFree>
coryphaeus: <entryFree id="n11370" type="greek" key="co^ry^phaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏryphaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">korufai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n11370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader, chief, head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicureorum Zeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coryphasia: <entryFree id="n11371" type="main" key="Co^ry^pha_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏryphāsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">korufasi/a</foreign> (v. Anthol. Gr. 1, p. 226), <sense id="n11371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a title of Minerva</hi> (from her worship at <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏryphāsĭum</orth>, <itype>a promontory on the south coast of Messenia</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 18</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coryphe: <entryFree id="n11372" type="main" key="Co^ry^phe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏryphē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrypha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Oceanus, mother of the fourth Minerva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coryphia: <entryFree id="n11373" type="main" key="coryphi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coryphĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of murex</hi> or <hi rend="ital">snail, yielding a purple dye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 27, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corysidia: <entryFree id="n11374" type="main" key="corysidia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">corysidia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name of the plant Minyas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 100, § 157</bibl> (corinthia, Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
corythus: <entryFree id="n11375" type="main" key="Co^ry^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏrythus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/ruqos</foreign>. <sense id="n11375.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient town in Etruria</hi>, so named from its mythical founder, later called <hi rend="ital">Cortona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 209</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 719</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., for <hi rend="ital">Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 10</bibl>; and for <hi rend="ital">Italia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 170</bibl> Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n11375.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 125</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11375.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Paris and Œnone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 361</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11375.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 290</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
corytos: <entryFree id="n11376" type="main" key="co_ry_to^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōrȳtŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tus</orth> (˘˘ <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11, 56</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwruto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quiver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 169</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:443" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 443</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:269" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 269</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velox corytus et arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:660" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 660</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coryza: <entryFree id="n11377" type="greek" key="co^ry_za"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏrȳza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/ruza</foreign>, <sense id="n11377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a catarrh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:17:101" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 17, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cos: <entryFree id="n11378" type="main" key="co_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōs</orth>, <itype>cōtis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. ça, to whet, sharpen; cf. cautes</etym>, <sense id="n11378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any hard stone, flintstone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 4</bibl> and 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:8" default="NO">5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:23" default="NO">8, 11, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 43</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11378.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a whetstone, hone, grindstone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11378.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam iracundiam fortitudinis quasi cotem esse dicebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 304</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11379" type="main" key="Co_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cō^ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kw=s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*ko/ws</foreign>, <sense id="n11379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Sporadic Islands in the Myrtoan Sea, on the coast of Caria, celebrated for the cultivation of the vine and for weaving; the birthplace of Hippocrates, Apelles, and Philetas</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Stanco.; nom</hi>. Cos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Fragm. p. 363" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Fragm. p. 363</bibl> Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:135 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 135 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cous,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Coum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 19</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Coo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:252" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Co,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 7</bibl> (but in the last two pass. with the var. lect. Coo).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11379.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kw=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Cos, Coan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 8, 10, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:6" default="NO">2, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Apelles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:1:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—Hence, also: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <trans><tr>a celebrated picture of her by Apelles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senior,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hippocrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> Carm. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <trans><tr>Philetas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 329</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 1; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 760</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11379.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, </sense><sense id="n11379.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">Coan wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:135" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11379.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Coan garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 298</bibl>. <cb n="COST" /></sense></entryFree>
cosa: <entryFree id="n11380" type="main" key="Co^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (on coins also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cossa</orth>; access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 168</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/ssa</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*ko/ssai</foreign>. <sense id="n11380.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient town in Etruria, not far from the coast</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ansedonia</hi>, above <hi rend="ital">Orbitello</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 39 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11380.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏ-sānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Coss-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Cosa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, </sense><sense id="n11380.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏsā-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n11380.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The territory around Cosa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11380.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A country seat near Cosa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 27, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11380.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏsā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cosa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 24, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11380.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Lucania, in the territory of the Thurini</hi>, the same as Consa or Compsa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
coscinomantia: <entryFree id="n11381" type="gloss" key="cosci^no^manti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coscĭnŏmantīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koskinomantei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n11381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a divination by the sieve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:5, p. 426" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 5, p. 426</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cosconius: <entryFree id="n11382" type="main" key="Cosco_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coscōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n11382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman plebeian</hi> gens; esp., </sense><sense id="n11382.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Cosconius, <hi rend="ital">prætor during Cicero's consulate, also known as a writer on antiquities</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 39</bibl>, and § 89 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 14, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11382.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Cosconius Calidianus, <hi rend="ital">an inferior orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11382.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A writer of epigrams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:77:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 77, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:69:7" default="NO">3, 69, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cosmeta: <entryFree id="n11383" type="greek" key="cosme_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cosmēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kosmh/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n11383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who ornaments one, an adorner;</hi> a designation of a slave who had charge of the wardrobe and decoration of his mistress, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:477" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 477</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cosmicos: <entryFree id="n11384" type="greek" key="cosmi^co^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cosmĭcŏs</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kosmiko/s</foreign> (syn. mundanus), <sense id="n11384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the world;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11384.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cosmĭcŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a citizen of the world, a cosmopolite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:41:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 41, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11384.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cosmĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">worldly things</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:41:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 41, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cosmittere: <entryFree id="n11385" type="gloss" key="cosmittere"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cosmittere</orth>, <itype>old form for committere</itype>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=67:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 67, 8</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
cosmoe: <entryFree id="n11386" type="main" key="Cosmoe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cosmoe</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/smoi</foreign>, <sense id="n11386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high council of the Cretans</hi>, answering to the Lacedaemonian Ephori, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Moser <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cosmographia: <entryFree id="n11387" type="greek" key="cosmo_^gra^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cosmō^grăphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kosmografi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n11387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a description of the universe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cosmographus: <entryFree id="n11388" type="greek" key="cosmo^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cosmŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kosmogra/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n11388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who describes the world, a cosmographer</hi>, Auct. Progen. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 2</bibl>; Mythogr. Lat. 3, 6, 35.</sense></entryFree>
cosmus: <entryFree id="n11389" type="main" key="Cosmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cosmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated maker of, and dealer in unguents at Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:8:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:89:2" default="NO">1, 89, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:110:1" default="NO">14, 110, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cosmĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., named</hi> or <hi rend="ital">derived from Cosmus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampullae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 26</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cosmĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. unguentum), <hi rend="ital">an unguent made by him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:55:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 55, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:15:6" default="NO">11, 15, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cossigerare: <entryFree id="n11390" type="main" key="cossi^ge^ra_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cossĭgĕrāre</orth> (perh. corrupted), word of unknown meaning, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 61, 24</bibl>.</entryFree>
cossim: <entryFree id="n11391" type="main" key="cossim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cossim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cessim.</entryFree>
cossinius: <entryFree id="n11392" type="main" key="Cossinius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cossinius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n11392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman gentile name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:23:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 23, 53 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cossus: <entryFree id="n11393" type="main" key="cossus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cossus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of larva under the bark of trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 33, 38, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:220" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 24, 37, § 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:115" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 13, 39, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11394" type="main" key="Cossus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cossus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Cornelia (cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 9</bibl> Müll.); <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. the military tribune in the war with the Veientes, A. Cornelius Cossus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:841" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 841</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:21 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 21 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cossutianae: <entryFree id="n11395" type="main" key="Cossu^ti^a_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cossŭtĭānae</orth> <itype>Tabernae</itype>, <sense id="n11395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place near Cæsena in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cossutianus: <entryFree id="n11396" type="main" key="Cossu^ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cossŭtĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name;</hi> esp. Cossutianus Capito, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cossutius: <entryFree id="n11397" type="main" key="Cossu^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cossŭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n11397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl>, pr. 15 al.</sense></entryFree>
costa: <entryFree id="n11398" type="main" key="costa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">costa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rib</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 82, § 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:48:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 48, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11398.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a side, a wall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aheni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 19, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 75</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
costabilis: <entryFree id="n11399" type="main" key="costa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">costābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>costa</etym>, <sense id="n11399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">riblike</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
costamomum: <entryFree id="n11400" type="main" key="costa^mo_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">costămōmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>costum - amomum</etym>, <sense id="n11400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an aromatic plant, similar to the</hi> costum <hi rend="ital">and</hi> amomum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
costatus: <entryFree id="n11401" type="hapax" key="costa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">costātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>costa</etym>, <sense id="n11401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having <cb n="COTT" /> ribs, ribbed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene costati boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
costum: <entryFree id="n11402" type="greek" key="costum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">costum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (access. form, like the Greek, <orth extent="full" lang="la">costŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:917" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 917</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ko/stos</foreign>, <sense id="n11402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Oriental aromatic plant</hi>: Costus Arabicus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 25, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 308</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 44 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. used in the preparation of costly unguents,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 15 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 1, 2, § 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in offerings,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">for the preservation of fruits,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:5 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 5 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cosyra: <entryFree id="n11403" type="main" key="Co^sy_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏsȳra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Coss-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cossūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island between Sicily and Africa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pantellaria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:567" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 567</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:272" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cotaria: <entryFree id="n11404" type="main" key="co_ta_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōtārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cotoriae.</entryFree>
cothon: <entryFree id="n11405" type="main" key="Co_tho_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōthōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>orig. a Semitic word, but identified by the Greeks with <foreign lang="greek">kw/qwn</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n11405.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a name given to any artificial harbor</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37, 9</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n11405.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n11405.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The artificial inner harbor of Carthage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 427</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11405.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A similar harbor at Adrumetum</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 62 sq.—</sense><sense id="n11405.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several islands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cothurnate: <entryFree id="n11406" type="main" key="co^thurna_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏthurnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cothurnatus <sense id="n11406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cothurnatio: <entryFree id="n11407" type="main" key="co^thurna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏthurnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cothurnatus</etym>, <sense id="n11407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tragic representation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cothurnatus: <entryFree id="n11408" type="main" key="co^thurna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏthurnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cothurnus</etym>, <sense id="n11408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the</hi> cothurnus, lit. <hi rend="ital">buskined;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">elevated, lofty, tragic</hi> (opp. excalceatus, comic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:76:31" default="NO">76, 31</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): Maronis grande opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:5:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycophron, Ov. lb. 529: vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Am. 2:18:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:F. 5:348" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—* <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-thurnātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">loftily, tragically;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cothurnatius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cothurnus: <entryFree id="n11409" type="greek" key="co^thurnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏthurnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/qornos</foreign>, <sense id="n11409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high Grecian shoe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11409.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:4 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11409.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n11409.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A high Grecian hunting-boot, laced up in front, and covering the whole foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:506" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 506</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11409.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The high shoe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">buskin worn by tragic actors</hi> (while soccus was the shoe of the comic actor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A.
