cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes creantur fortibus et bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—Also of woman: <cit><quote lang="la">pueris beata creandis Uxor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 26, 2</bibl>.—Hence, in poets freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, with <case>abl.</case> (<hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">sprung from, begotten by, born of;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subst., an offspring, a child</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 303 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things made</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 572</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11543.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., publicist. t. t. (cf. facio), <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">create for any jurisdiction</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to choose, elect</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui comitiatu creare consules rite possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo ex unā familiā magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit> (five times): <cit><quote lang="la">magistrum equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 57, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interregem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 31, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuniciam potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Imperatorem (with eligere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem gerendo bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 8</bibl></cit>. curatorem reipublicae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:8:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11543.4" n="2" level="3"> Of the officer who appoints or superintends an election: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (consules) cum Ti. Gracchus consul iterum crearet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11543.5" n="3" level="3"> In eccl. Lat. of the exercise of divine power in creation, <hi rend="ital">to create, call into being, endow with existence</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum et terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11543.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor mundum in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:50:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 50, 11 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n11543.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to produce, prepare, cause, occasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem meis inimicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoditatem mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis has aerumnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitalem fraudem tuis cruribus capitique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorem (similitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedium ac satietatem ex similitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:143" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomitum dissolutionemque stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 48, 72, § 155</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11544" type="main" key="Cre^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĕo</orth>, <itype>or</itype>, anal. to the Gr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĕon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kre/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n11544.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Corinth, who betrothed his daughter Creusa to Jason</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 25" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 526" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 526</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:64" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11544.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brother of Jocaste, at Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 72" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:477" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 477</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 678</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crepae: <entryFree id="n11545" type="gloss" key="crepae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crepae</orth>, i. q. caprae, <sense id="n11545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she-goats</hi>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48, 16</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
crepatura: <entryFree id="n11546" type="main" key="cre^pa_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crepo</etym>, <sense id="n11546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fissure, crack</hi> (late Lat.): parietum, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:196" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crepax: <entryFree id="n11547" type="hapax" key="cre^pax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding, creaking</hi>: mola, Maecen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
creper: <entryFree id="n11548" type="main" key="cre^per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕper</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sabine; kindr. with Sanscr. kshapā, night, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kne/fas</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dusky, dark;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">uncertain, obscure, doubtful, wavering</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:7:section=77" default="NO">7, § 77</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 13, 15 sq.</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52, 18</bibl> Müll. *</sense><sense id="n11548.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11548.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: res, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 13, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. p. 21 sq" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. p. 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">belli certamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1295</bibl></cit>: oracla, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 14, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crepiculum: <entryFree id="n11549" type="spur" key="cre^pi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭcŭlum</orth>, v. crepitulum).</entryFree>
crepida: <entryFree id="n11550" type="greek" key="cre^pi^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krhpi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sole which served the Greeks, and the Romans who adopted Grecian habits, as a shoe, a sandal</hi> (pure Lat. solea; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 5 sq.</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:127 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 127 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sutor supra crepidam (judicaret),</quote> <trans><tr>let the cobbler stick to his last</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12</bibl>, ext. 3.</sense></entryFree>
crepidarius: <entryFree id="n11551" type="main" key="cre^pi^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭdārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crepida</etym>, <sense id="n11551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the sole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sandal</hi>: sutor, <hi rend="ital">a sandal-maker, shoemaker</hi>, Sempr. Asell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 8</bibl>: culter, Gell. ib.</sense></entryFree>
crepidatus: <entryFree id="n11552" type="main" key="cre^pi^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing sandals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38, 92</bibl> and 93; Suet. Dom. <cb n="CREP" /> 4: fabula, <hi rend="ital">a kind of Græco-Roman tragedy</hi>, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 7</bibl>; cf. Neukirch. Fab. Tog. pp. 15 and 57.</sense></entryFree>
crepido: <entryFree id="n11553" type="main" key="cre^pi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">krhpi/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n11553.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a ground, basis, foundation, a socle, pedestal, base</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 9, 14, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11553.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an elevated enclosure, a high projection, an edge, brim, brink, border, dam, dike, pier, shore, bank</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:37:section=97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 37, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 653</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11553.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tamquam crepidine quādam comprehensione longiore sustinentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:224" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 224</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crepidula: <entryFree id="n11554" type="main" key="cre^pi^du^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭdŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>crepida</etym>, <sense id="n11554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sandal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crepidulum: <entryFree id="n11555" type="main" key="cre^pi^du^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭdŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. crepitulum <sense id="n11555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
crepis: <entryFree id="n11556" type="greek" key="cre_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krhpi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 59, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crepitacillum: <entryFree id="n11557" type="main" key="cre^pi^ta_cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭtācillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>crepitaculum</etym>, <sense id="n11557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small rattle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 229</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crepitaculum: <entryFree id="n11558" type="main" key="cre^pi^ta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭtācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>crepito</etym>, <sense id="n11558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rattle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:54" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, §§ 909, 927.</sense></entryFree>
crepito: <entryFree id="n11559" type="main" key="cre^pi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n11559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [crepo], <hi rend="ital">to rattle much, to creak, crackle, clatter, rustle, rumble, chatter, murmur</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 746</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 735</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapillis unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:604" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā grandine nimbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 459</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 449</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leni vento brattea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duris incudibus enses,</quote> <trans><tr>to ring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 540</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:73" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 783</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvo auro rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:648" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammā crepitante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepitanti sistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 11 (9 Bib.), 43 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 784</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">intestina (with crepant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos salis in igne nec crepitat nec exsilit,</quote> <trans><tr>crepitates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crepitulum: <entryFree id="n11560" type="gloss" key="cre^pi^tu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭtŭlum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpic-</orth>; <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>) ornamentum capitis, idem enim in capitis motu crepitum facit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52:19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52, 19</bibl> Müll. —Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭdŭlum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</entryFree>
crepitus: <entryFree id="n11561" type="main" key="cre^pi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crepo</etym>, <sense id="n11561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rattling, creaking, clattering, clashing, rustling, a noise</hi>, etc. (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n11561.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cardinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">claustrorum (with sonitus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e motu frenorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <trans><tr>a chattering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:12:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 12, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 17, 5</bibl>: alarum (anserum). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 47, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inlisae manus umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibiarum et scabellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 18, 20, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrium,</quote> <trans><tr>a pattering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus, tonitrus,</quote> <trans><tr>a crash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: digitorum, <hi rend="ital">a snapping of the fingers</hi>, as the signal of a command (cf. crepo and concrepo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:119" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 119</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11561.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: crepitus (sc. ventris), <hi rend="ital">a breaking wind with noise</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">pordh/</foreign> (diff. from flatus, without noise), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 5</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:110 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 87, § 110 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crepo: <entryFree id="n11562" type="main" key="cre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n11562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. krap, to lament; cf. crabro] (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; in class. prose, concrepo). </sense><sense id="n11562.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to rattle, crack, creak, rustle, clatter, tinkle, jingle, chink</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11562.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina (with crepitant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba Sabina ad focos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 58; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:742" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 742</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonabile sistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 784</bibl></cit> (cf. crepitanti sistro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 11 (9 Bip.), 43): crepante pede. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:48" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes subito motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:501" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis, in statuā Memnonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 58</bibl></cit> et saep.: digiti crepantis signa novit eunuchus, <hi rend="ital">a snapping the fingers</hi> (as a sign of a command), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 15</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">concrepo, I.—Of the voice: vox generosa, quae non composita nec alienis auribus sed subito data crepuit,</quote> <trans><tr>because loud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11562.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to break wind</hi>, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. prohibere, p. 206; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 77</bibl> and 78; cf. crepitus, B.—In a play upon words: <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Fores hae fecerunt magnum flagitium modo. <hi rend="ital">Ad.</hi> Quid id est flagitii? <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Crepuerunt clare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11562.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break with a</hi> <pb n="481" /> <cb n="CRES" /> <hi rend="ital">crash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 206</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11562.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to make something sound, make a noise with, cause to resound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rattle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11562.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Camenae) manibus faustos ter crepuere sonos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>clapped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 10, 4; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ter laetum sonum populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul auxiliantia aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:687" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 687</bibl></cit>: aureolos, <hi rend="ital">to make to chink</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to count</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:19:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 19, 14</bibl>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n11562.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to say something</hi> or <hi rend="ital">talk noisily, to make much ado about, to boast of, prattle, prate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego ad mensam publicas res clamo neque leges crepo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcos et vineta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunda dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post vina gravem militiam aut pauperiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: crepat, antiquum genus ut ... tolerarit aevum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crepulus: <entryFree id="n11563" type="main" key="cre^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crepo</etym>, <sense id="n11563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rattling, resounding, crashing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">buccae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crepundia: <entryFree id="n11564" type="main" key="cre^pundi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpundĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rattle;</hi> and specif., </sense><sense id="n11564.1" n="I" level="1"> Most freq., <hi rend="ital">a child's rattle</hi> (cf. Ruhnk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 15</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:313" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 313</bibl> Jahn ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 270</bibl>.—Hence, ‡ <cit><quote lang="la">A CREPVNDIIS,</quote> <trans><tr>from childhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1183</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11564.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An amulet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 310, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11564.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rattling musical instruments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crepusci: <entryFree id="n11565" type="gloss" key="cre^pusci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpusci</orth>, <itype>qui eodem tempore erant nati</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 5</bibl> [creper].</entryFree>
crepusculascens: <entryFree id="n11566" type="main" key="cre^puscu^lascens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpuscŭlascens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [crepusculum], <sense id="n11566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growing dusk, dusky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crepusculum: <entryFree id="n11567" type="main" key="cre^puscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĕpuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>creper</etym>, <sense id="n11567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twilight, dusk</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 5</bibl> Müll.); and in partic., <hi rend="ital">evening twilight, the dusk of the evening</hi> (opp. diluculum, the morning twilight, dawn; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n11567.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 219</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 681</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:735" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 735</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 58, § 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11567.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter per opaca crepuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:596" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 596</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cres: <entryFree id="n11568" type="main" key="Cres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cres</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, v. Creta, II. A.</entryFree>
crescentia: <entryFree id="n11569" type="main" key="crescenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cresco</etym>, <sense id="n11569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an increase, augmentation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum (opp. brevitates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cresco: <entryFree id="n11570" type="main" key="cresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cresco</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n11570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> sync. cresse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 683</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [1. creo]. </sense><sense id="n11570.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig., of things not previously in existence, <hi rend="ital">to come forth, grow, to arise, spring, be born, become visible, appear</hi> (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) </sense><sense id="n11570.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae sursum crescunt sursumque creantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque e terrā corpora crescunt (for which, subsequently, exoriuntur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:868" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 868</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore de patrio ac materno sanguine crescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic et acanthus Et rosa crescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 397</bibl></cit>.—So esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">arisen, sprung, descended from, born of;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortali corpore cretus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:906" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 906</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortali semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore materno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nativo corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semiramio sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amyntore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:307" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 307</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 672</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 750</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab origine eādem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 607</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojano a sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11570.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec villa inter manus meas crevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens hic terris crescit labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:75" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 75</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n11570.4" n="II" level="1"> Of things already in existence, <hi rend="ital">to rise in height, to rise, grow, grow up, thrive, increase</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11570.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 254</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fruges, arbusta, animantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 808</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia paulatim crescunt (with grandescere alique),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:190 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 190 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (ostrea) cum lunā pariter crescant pariterque decrescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lecticis crescunt (infantes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cresce, puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 643</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cujus domo creverat,</quote> <trans><tr>had grown up, been reared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander per quinquennium sub Aristotele doctore mclito crevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus in aestatem crescit campisque redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 713</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liger ex nivibus creverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in frondem crines, in ramos bracchia,</quote> <trans><tr>to grow into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 550</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ungues manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:479" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in immensum Atlas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:661" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in latitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to increase in breadth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 87, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super ora caputque onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut clivo crevisse putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 191</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n11570.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to increase in number to</hi>, <cb n="CRET" /> <hi rend="ital">augment, multiply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi absenti crevisse amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:32:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 32, 69</bibl></cit> (B. and K. ex conj. <hi rend="ital">de</hi>crevisse): <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc crescentibus annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11570.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11570.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to grow, increase, to be enlarged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strengthened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Atheniensium opes senescere, contra Lacedaemoniorum crescere videret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hostium opes animique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non animi tantum, sed etiam vires crescebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus laude crescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus crevit praetori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusvis opes contra illius potentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusquam regnum per scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia paucorum (opp. plebis opes imminutae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 39, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (mala) primo paulatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo pecuniae, deinde imperii cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga atque formido latius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 55, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 51, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopia omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum cognitio cottidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā ex re creverat cum famā tum opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Saguntini) in tantas brevi creverant opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodiorum civitas populi Romani opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui malo rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ego postera Crescam laude recens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a brevibus in longas (iambi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:136" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11570.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">increase in distinction, honor, courage</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be promoted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advanced, to prosper, to become great, attain honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusarem alios potius, ex quibus possem crescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex invidiā senatoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de uno isto, de multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitate, gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescendi in curiā occasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cresco et exsulto et discussā senectute recalesco, quotiens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 34:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 34, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudet et ex nostro crescit maerore Charaxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic uno modo crescere potest, si se ipse summittat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:71:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 71, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cresius: <entryFree id="n11571" type="main" key="Cre_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1, Creta, II. B.</entryFree>
creta: <entryFree id="n11572" type="main" key="Cre_ta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Crētē, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 668</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 735</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Creten, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 34 al.</bibl>; <sense id="n11572.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">on the contrary, Cretam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:129 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 129 al.</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*krh/th</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Crete, an island in the Mediterranean Sea, distinguished in ancient times by its fruitfulness and very early cultivation</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Candia</hi>, Mel. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:29" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:34:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 37</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n11572.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crēs</orth>, <itype>Crētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cressa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*krh/s, *krh=ssa</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Cretan;</hi> or as <hi rend="ital">subst., a Cretan; a Cretan woman</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11572.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> Cres: <cit><quote lang="la">Epimenides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number> Cretes, <hi rend="ital">the Cretans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 19</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Cretum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:594 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 594 al.</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Cretăs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 348</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:441 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 441 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11572.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> <itype>Cressa</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 345</bibl></cit>: nota, <hi rend="ital">made with Cretan earth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chalk</hi> (v. 2. Creta, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae, for healing in gen.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:61" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 61</bibl></cit> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 412</bibl>, perh. for dictamnus): bos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pasiphaë</hi> (q. v.), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 57.—<pos>Subst.</pos> for <hi rend="ital">Ariadne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 16</bibl>; for <hi rend="ital">Aĕrope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 327</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11572.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crēsĭus</orth> (in MSS. and edd. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cressĭus</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 285</bibl> Wagn.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*krh:sios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia, i. e. taurus (v. C.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:582 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 582 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11572.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 19, 26: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <trans><tr>the bullock which Neptune sent to Minos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 434</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētae-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Cretan</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Epimenides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (25), 29.—* </sense><sense id="n11572.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Cretan</hi> (prob. a word coined in sport), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11572.7" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo, judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit> and 14: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Cretans</hi> (<hi rend="ital">renowned as archers</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 60, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:25:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 25, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11572.8" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labyrinthus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <trans><tr>an amphimacrus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl></cit> P. al.: versus, <cb n="CREU" /> <hi rend="ital">composed of the amphimacrus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 513</bibl> ib. al.—</sense><sense id="n11572.9" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n11572.10" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of</hi> Q. Metellus, <hi rend="ital">from his subjugation of Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8:1" default="NO">3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:594" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 594</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11572.11" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> clematitis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 54, § 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11572.12" n="c" level="4"> In the Gr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> hibiscus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 38</bibl> and 62.—</sense><sense id="n11572.13" n="G" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Cretan</hi> (woman): <cit><quote lang="la">Nymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:444" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 444</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11573" type="main" key="cre_ta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orig. <pos>adj.</pos>, from 1. Creta</etym>, <sense id="n11573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Cretan earth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">chalk, white earth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11573.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:195 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 195 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:8 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 8 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. used for cleansing garments,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">creta est profecto horum hominum oratio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>removes all trouble from the mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 10 sq.</bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">Also used as a cosmetic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:93:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 93, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:17 al" default="NO">8, 33, 17 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for seals,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 16, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. cretula, for marking <hi rend="ital">the goal in a race-course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 65, § 160</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for the making of earthen vessels,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 123</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus cretae Oaxes,</quote> <trans><tr>turbulent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 66</bibl></cit> Rib. (dub. al. Cretae; v. Forbig. ad loc.). —</sense><sense id="n11573.2" n="II" level="1"> From its whiteness is borrowed the trope for <hi rend="ital">something favorable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi> (opp. carbo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 246</bibl>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:108" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cretaceus: <entryFree id="n11574" type="hapax" key="cre_ta_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. creta</etym>, <sense id="n11574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chalk-like, cretaceous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cretaeus: <entryFree id="n11575" type="main" key="Cre_taeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Creta, II. C.</entryFree>
cretanus: <entryFree id="n11576" type="main" key="Cre_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. Creta, II. D.</entryFree>
cretarius: <entryFree id="n11577" type="main" key="cre_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. creta</etym>, <sense id="n11577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to chalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ARS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 641, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11577.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crētārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. taberna), <hi rend="ital">a shop for Cretan earth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 55</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cretatus: <entryFree id="n11578" type="main" key="cre_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marked with chalk</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11578.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 18, 58, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos (decorated as an offering),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabulla,</quote> <trans><tr>whitened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:41:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 41, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11578.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: ambitio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the candidates for office, clothed in white</hi> (candidatorum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:177" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crete: <entryFree id="n11579" type="main" key="Cre_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. 1, Creta <sense id="n11579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cretensis: <entryFree id="n11580" type="main" key="Cre_tensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. 1, Creta, II. E.</entryFree>
creterra: <entryFree id="n11581" type="main" key="cre_terra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēterra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cratera.</entryFree>
creteus: <entryFree id="n11582" type="hapax" key="cre_te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. creta</etym>, <sense id="n11582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of chalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 298</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crethmos: <entryFree id="n11583" type="greek" key="cre_thmo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crēthmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krh=qmos</foreign>, <sense id="n11583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sea-fennel</hi>: Crithmum maritimum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 96, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:82" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 50, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cretica: <entryFree id="n11584" type="main" key="cre_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">crētĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. 1. Creta, II. F. 2. b.</entryFree>
creticus: <entryFree id="n11585" type="main" key="Cre_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Creta, II. F.</entryFree>
cretifodina: <entryFree id="n11586" type="main" key="cre_ti^fo^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētĭ-fŏdīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. creta</etym>, <sense id="n11586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chalk-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay-pit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=5 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cretio: <entryFree id="n11587" type="main" key="cre_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cerno, II.</etym>; jurid. t. t., <sense id="n11587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the format declaration by the heir of his intention to enter upon his inheritance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11587.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 164</bibl> sqq.; 2, 171 sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 22, 25</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll.: simplex, <hi rend="ital">fruitless</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">where there is no property</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera,</quote> <trans><tr>without restrictions by the testator</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 46, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:101 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 101 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11587.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inheritance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 24, § 95 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cretis: <entryFree id="n11588" type="main" key="Cre_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. 1. Creta, II. G.</entryFree>
cretosus: <entryFree id="n11589" type="main" key="cre_to_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. creta</etym>, <sense id="n11589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in chalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura Cimoli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cretula: <entryFree id="n11590" type="main" key="cre_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white clay, used for sealing</hi>, = terra sigillata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 31, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cretura: <entryFree id="n11591" type="main" key="cre_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cerno</etym>; concr., <sense id="n11591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the siftings of corn, bran, chaff</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cretus: <entryFree id="n11592" type="main" key="cre_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from cerno.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11593" type="main" key="cre_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from cresco. q. v. I. A. <sense id="n11593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
creusa: <entryFree id="n11594" type="main" key="Cre^u_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĕūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kre/ousa</foreign>. <sense id="n11594.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of king Creon, of Corinth, married to Jason, and on that account put to death by Medea by means of a charmed offering</hi> (a garment, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:65" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 65</bibl>; a garment and a golden chain, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 571 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 571 sq.</bibl>; a crown, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:601" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 601</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 105, 109, § 235</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 25" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 496" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 496</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:509 al" default="NO">509 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11594.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Priam, and wife of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 738</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11594.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town, with a harbor, in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 21</bibl>, <pb n="482" /> <cb n="CRIM" /> 5; 42, 56, 5.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Creūsis</orth>, acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*kreu=sis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cribello: <entryFree id="n11595" type="main" key="cri_bello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crībello</orth>, no <sense id="n11595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cribellum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to pass through a sieve, to sift</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 17 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cribellum: <entryFree id="n11596" type="main" key="cri_bellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crībellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cribrum</etym>, <sense id="n11596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sieve</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jun. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cribrarius: <entryFree id="n11597" type="main" key="cri_bra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crībrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a sieve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrarius alica,</quote> <trans><tr>sifted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29</bibl></cit>, §115.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">crībrārĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a sieve-maker</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">koskinopoio/s</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
cribro: <entryFree id="n11598" type="main" key="cri_bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crībro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pass through a sieve, to sift</hi> (perh. not anteAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 51, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:76 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 15, § 76 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cribrum: <entryFree id="n11599" type="main" key="cri_brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crībrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from root cer, whence cerno</etym>, <sense id="n11599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sieve, searce, riddle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25, 76, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:108 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 28, § 108 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 437</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:112" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 112</bibl> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Facete, of a slave whose back was pierced by goads: carnificum cribrum, Plant. Most. 1, 1, 52.—Prov.: imbrem in cribrum gerere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to labor in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crimen: <entryFree id="n11600" type="main" key="cri_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. for cernimen, from cerno, II. C.</etym>; lit., <sense id="n11600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judicial decision, verdict, judgment;</hi> hence, transf., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kri=ma</foreign>, of the subject of such a decision, and with partieular reference either to the accuser or to the accused. </sense><sense id="n11600.1" n="I" level="1"> Subject., or with reference to the accuser, <hi rend="ital">a charge, accusation, reproach;</hi> esp. when unfounded, <hi rend="ital">a calumny, slander</hi> (very freq. in every period and species of composition): <cit><quote lang="la">criminin' me habuisse fidem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae litterae fidem Persei criminibus fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum respondero criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se falsis criminibus circumventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 2</bibl></cit>;
