cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen falsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus adversariorum in invidiam venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones pleni criminum in Patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina et suspiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti maleficii crimen probare te censes posse talibus viris, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris maximi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 23, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 24, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius conjurationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 1, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi est crimen quod reprehenditis?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the point of the accusation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 80</bibl></cit> Halm ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo enim illi crimine peccatoque perierunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 30, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec causa est omnium horum scelerum atque criminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 61</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (approaching the signif. II. A. infra), id C. Norbano in nefario crimine atque in fraude capitali esse ponendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit> Sorof ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">era in crimen veniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 55</bibl></cit> (era male audiet, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid? sciebas tibi crimini datum iri?</quote> <trans><tr>would be made a reproach?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29, § 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 766</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen inferre, offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos crimen intendebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in crimine,</quote> <trans><tr>to stand charged with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propulsare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to repel, confute</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 303</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and opp. obicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repellere, transferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: belli, <hi rend="ital">pretexts</hi> (causae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 339</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11600.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">an object of reproach</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuae crimen posteritatis eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:9:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 9, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11600.3" n="II" level="1"> Object., or with reference to the accused, <hi rend="ital">the fault complained of, a crime, fault, offence</hi> (freq., but rare in ante-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n11600.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11600.5" n="1" level="3"> Ingen.: <cit><quote lang="la">foedati crimine turpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec (causa) non in crimine aliquo, quod ille posset infitiari ... consisteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 182</bibl></cit> Sorof ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen meum indicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 25, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carendum non solum crimine turpitudinis, verum etiam suspicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quidam crimen ultro faterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut crimen taedas exosa jugales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non prodere vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:447" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:614" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si crimen erit, crimen amoris erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 30, 24; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum crimen erit,</quote> <trans><tr>thy fault</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 28, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina et innoxios discernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 55</bibl></cit>.—Ovid in his Tristia very freq. calls the offence on account of which he was banished crimina or crimen, interchanging it with error, e. g. 1, 9, 64; 2, 3; 2, 207; 3, 5, 52; 3, 6, 26 al.—</sense><sense id="n11600.6" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina brassicae sunt, animae gravitatem facere, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>fault, defect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 35</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CRIM" /> § 91.—</sense><sense id="n11600.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the crime of lewdness, adultery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:634" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 634</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11600.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11600.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An object representing a crime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et rupit pictas, caelestia crimina, vestes, i. e. deorum adulteria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum paries nullo crimine pictus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 34</bibl></cit> (2, 5, 26 Bip.): <cit><quote lang="la">impressā signat sua crimina gemmā,</quote> <trans><tr>a letter containing her crime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 566</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11600.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A cause of a crime, a criminal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se causam clamat crimenque caputque malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 600</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a pereant Baiae, crimen amoris, aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crimen et illa fuit ... Myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit> (4, 18), 15.</sense></entryFree>
crimessus: <entryFree id="n11601" type="main" key="Cri_messus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīmessus</orth>, v. Crimisus.</entryFree>
criminalis: <entryFree id="n11602" type="main" key="cri_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crimen</etym>, <sense id="n11602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to crime, criminal</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 41, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 35, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">criminally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agi furti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
criminaliter: <entryFree id="n11603" type="main" key="cri_mi^na_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. criminalis <sense id="n11603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
criminatio: <entryFree id="n11604" type="main" key="cri_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>criminor</etym>, <sense id="n11604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accusation, complaint, calumny</hi> (in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">criminatione in me absentem uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminatio tua quae est? Roscium cum Flavio pro societate decidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 321</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54, 8 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 26, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:14:3 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 14, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
criminator: <entryFree id="n11605" type="main" key="cri_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accuser, a calumniator</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alios (opp. sui obtegens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of the devil, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
criminatrix: <entryFree id="n11606" type="main" key="cri_mi^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>criminator</etym>, <sense id="n11606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female accuser, calumniator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Paul. ad Tit. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crimino: <entryFree id="n11607" type="main" key="cri_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> collat. form of criminor, <hi rend="ital">to accuse, make an accusation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 78</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: apud aliquem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 470, 16</bibl> (Sat. v. 9 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n11607.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sullanas res defendere criminor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 4, 13</bibl></cit> dub. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminatum esse ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
criminor: <entryFree id="n11608" type="main" key="cri_mi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>crimen, I.</etym>. <sense id="n11608.0" n="(a)" level="5"> With a personal object, <hi rend="ital">to accuse one of crime, to complain of, impeach, calumniate</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc metui ne me criminaretur tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl>; cf. under <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Metellum apud populum Romanum criminatus est, bellum illum ducere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopinantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:64 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 64 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11608.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With things as objects, <hi rend="ital">to complain of, to charge with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (contionibus) cotidie potentiam meam invidiose criminabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas argumentando crimenve dissolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid de illā tribu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem Paullini, vigorem Celsi, maturitatem Galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetoricen vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilitatem inopiamque ejus apud amicos Alexandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum absenti principi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> supra.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de amicitiā, quam a me violatam esse criminatus est, pauca dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 37, 3</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11608.2" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., to accuse, criminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego vos ultum injurias hortor ... neque discordias, ut illi criminantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 17</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberio criminante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
criminose: <entryFree id="n11609" type="main" key="cri_mi^no_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. criminosus <sense id="n11609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
criminosus: <entryFree id="n11610" type="main" key="cri_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crimen, I.</etym>, <sense id="n11610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of reproaches, reproachful, accusalory, calumniating, slanderous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne cum me nimium gratum illi esse dicant, id mihi criminosum esse possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:67:section=162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 67, § 162</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iambi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminosissimus liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille acerbus, criminosus, popularis homo ac turbulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crīmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a guilty man</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 57</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40, 52</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crī-mĭnōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">reproach fully, slanderously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 43, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crimisus: <entryFree id="n11611" type="main" key="Cri_mi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīmīsus</orth> (in MSS. and edd. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crī-messus, Crīmissus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Crīnīsus</orth>, and <cb n="CRIS" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīnissus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*krimi=so/s</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">*krimisso/s</foreign>), <sense id="n11611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river on the south-west coast of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crinalis: <entryFree id="n11612" type="main" key="cri_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crinis</etym>, <sense id="n11612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the hair, hair-</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 403</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 576</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acus,</quote> <trans><tr>a hair-pin</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 4</bibl></cit>; for which <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crīnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a hair-comb</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore polypus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>furnished with hair-like feelers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 86</bibl> (s. v. crinis, II. B.).</sense></entryFree>
criniger: <entryFree id="n11613" type="hapax" key="cri_ni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīnĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crinis-gero</etym>, <sense id="n11613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having long hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 458</bibl> dub. (al. cirrigeros, with long curls).</sense></entryFree>
crininus: <entryFree id="n11614" type="greek" key="cri^ni^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĭnĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kri/ninos</foreign>, <sense id="n11614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of lilies, lily-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. crinon.</sense></entryFree>
crinio: <entryFree id="n11615" type="main" key="cri_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīnĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n11615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>crinis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to provide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover with hair;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> rare, and only transf. of leaves of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">frondibus crinitur arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 217</bibl>.—But freq., </sense><sense id="n11615.1" n="II" level="1"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crīnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">covered with hair, hairy;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">having long hair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">locks, long-haired.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11615.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Apollo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lopas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 740</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbae (sc. puerorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:49" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:418 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 418 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11615.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">galea triplici jubā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <trans><tr>a hairy star, a comet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 46</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 44, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crinis: <entryFree id="n11616" type="main" key="cri_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n11616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Atta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 202, 29</bibl>; acc. to the latter also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 69</bibl>; and so in Ritschl) [kindr. with crista; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ko/rus, korufh/</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">the hair.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11616.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in the poets),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 7, 8</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 480</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 20</bibl> et saep.: capere crines, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to marry</hi> (since the matrons distinguished themselves from maidens by their hair-dress), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 69</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 195</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=339:23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 339, 23</bibl> Müll.—Collectively, in <number>sing.</number>, = crines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 23</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n11616.2" n="B" level="2"> Rarely <hi rend="ital">a hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor rufa crinibus septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11616.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">objects resembling hair;</hi> so, </sense><sense id="n11616.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The tail of a comet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 528</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 849</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:25:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22</bibl>, §§ 89 and 90 al. (cf. crinitus, under crinio, II. B.); <hi rend="ital">the rays of stars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:42" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 42</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of the fire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:205" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 205</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11616.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The feelers of polypi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchas (polypi) conplexu crinium frangunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 86</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">of the cuttle-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11616.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fibres of wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines ramentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 82, § 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crinisus: <entryFree id="n11617" type="main" key="Cri_ni_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīnīsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Crimisus.</entryFree>
crinitus: <entryFree id="n11618" type="main" key="cri_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. crinio, II.</entryFree>
crinon: <entryFree id="n11619" type="greek" key="cri^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĭnon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">crĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kri/non</foreign>, <sense id="n11619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11619.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An unguent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 21</bibl> (where others read crinina; v. crininus).‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">crīŏbŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kriobo/lion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a ram as an offering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1899 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crisa: <entryFree id="n11620" type="main" key="Cri_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kri=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n11620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of Phocis, on the sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Crisso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 8</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Crisa</hi>: sinus = <foreign lang="greek">ko/lpos *Krisai=os</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crisimus: <entryFree id="n11621" type="greek" key="cri^si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĭsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kri/simos</foreign>, <sense id="n11621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">decisive, critical</hi>: dies, <hi rend="ital">the day of a crisis</hi>, in disease, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 14, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crisis: <entryFree id="n11622" type="greek" key="cri^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĭsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kri/sis</foreign>, medic. t. t., <sense id="n11622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decision, crisis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
criso: <entryFree id="n11623" type="main" key="cri_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīso</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">crisso</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to move the haunches</hi> (in mal. part.; of a female, as ceveo of a male), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 19, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:322" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 322</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:203" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 19, 4</bibl> Büch.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 260</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 293</bibl> ib.; v. Lachm. ad Lucr. vol. 2, p. 276 sq.</sense></entryFree>
crispans: <entryFree id="n11624" type="main" key="crispans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crispans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of crispo, q. v.</entryFree>
crispicans: <entryFree id="n11625" type="main" key="crispi^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crispĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from the unused <pos>v. a.</pos> crispico, āre [crispus], <sense id="n11625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">curling, ruffling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crispicapillus: <entryFree id="n11626" type="gloss" key="crispi^ca^pillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crispĭcăpillus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">ou)lo/qric</foreign> <sense id="n11626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having curled hair</hi>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
crispinus: <entryFree id="n11627" type="main" key="Crispi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crispīnus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n11627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:120 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 120 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Antonin. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crispisulcans: <entryFree id="n11628" type="hapax" key="crispi^sulcans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crispĭsulcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [crispussulco],<pb n="483" /> <cb n="CRIT" />  <sense id="n11628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undulating, serpentine</hi>: igneum fulmen, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:16:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 16, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crispitudo: <entryFree id="n11629" type="hapax" key="crispi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crispĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crispus</etym>, <sense id="n11629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tremulous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vibratory motion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crispo: <entryFree id="n11630" type="main" key="crispo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crispo</orth>, no <sense id="n11630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n11630.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to curl, crisp, crimp</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n11630.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 26, § 82</bibl></cit>: feminae cincinnos, Maec. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11630.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11630.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make variegated, rough, uneven; to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant with something, to strew over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem apio viridi,</quote> <trans><tr>to border</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:166" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtum aurum cono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:568" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alma novo crispans pelagus Tithonia Phoebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:311" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 311</bibl></cit>; cf. Zumpt ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quādam rugatione crispari corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11630.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put into a tremulous motion, to swing, brandish, wave</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vibro, quasso): bina manu lato crispans hastilia ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 313</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 165</bibl> (cf.: <foreign lang="greek">du/o dou=re tina/sswn</foreign>, Il. 12, 298): <cit><quote lang="la">non illis solitum crispare hastilia campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:374" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergeminos jactus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clunes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 239</bibl></cit>; cf. crispitudo.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cachinnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 316</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11630.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, only in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> crispans. </sense><sense id="n11630.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Curled, uneven, wrinkled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:87" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11630.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Trembling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vibrat crispante aedificiorum crepitu (of an earthquake),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 82, 84, § 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crispulus: <entryFree id="n11631" type="main" key="crispu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crispŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n11631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">curled, having curled hair, crisped, crimped</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n11631.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">comatus et crispulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 95:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 95, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:61:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 61, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11631.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">elaborate, artificial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Or. Ep. 3, p. 248" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Or. Ep. 3, p. 248</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crispus: <entryFree id="n11632" type="main" key="crispus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crispus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindred with crinis, crista; cf. cresco</etym>. <sense id="n11632.0" n="I" level="1"> Originally of the hair, <hi rend="ital">curled, crisped, crimped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cincinni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:120" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 120</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">leo crispioribus jubis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>.—Of persons, <hi rend="ital">having curled hair, curlyheaded</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 26</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11632.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">artistic, elaborate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crispum agmen orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. crispulus, II.—</sense><sense id="n11632.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11632.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Curled, uneven, waving, wrinkled</hi>: parietes abiete crispā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19</bibl>. 44: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crispae frondis apium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer montanum crispius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 15, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(marmor) Augusteum undatim crispum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca crispissimi folii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11632.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In tremulous motion, quivering, tremulous</hi>: linguae bisulcae jactu crispo fulgere, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 506, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecten (i. e. plectrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:382" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër subtili nebulā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11633" type="main" key="Crispus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crispus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> so esp. <hi rend="ital">of the well-known Roman historian</hi> C. Sallustius.</sense></entryFree>
crisso: <entryFree id="n11634" type="main" key="crisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crisso</orth>, v. criso.</entryFree>
crista: <entryFree id="n11635" type="main" key="crista1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. cer- in cerebrum, pro-ceres, = cel- in excello</etym>. <sense id="n11635.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a tuft on the head of animals;</hi> most freq. of <hi rend="ital">the comb of a cock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 4</bibl> and 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 56, 77, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:233 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 233 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a lapwing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 672</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a serpent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 669</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 44, § 122</bibl>.—Prov.: illi surgunt cristae, <hi rend="ital">his crest rises, he carries his head high</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">he is conceited</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11635.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11635.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tuft of leaves on plants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 43, § 86</bibl></cit>: crista galli or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> crista, <hi rend="ital">the name of a plant</hi>, = alectoros lophos, <hi rend="ital">the cock's comb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 5, 23, § 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11635.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The crest of a helmet, plume</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 633</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 39, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 468</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 779</bibl> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n11635.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The clitoris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:422" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 422</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11636" type="main" key="Crista2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cristatus: <entryFree id="n11637" type="main" key="crista_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cristātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crista</etym>, <sense id="n11637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a tuft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crest, tufted, crested</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11637.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:455" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 455</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cristati oris ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves, i. e. galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:223" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">draco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 599</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 13, 13, § 35</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11637.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">crested, plumed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cassis pennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:223" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 468</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cristula: <entryFree id="n11638" type="hapax" key="cristu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cristŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small crest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tuft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl> (al. cristis).</sense></entryFree>
critae: <entryFree id="n11639" type="greek" key="cri^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĭtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kritai/</foreign>, <sense id="n11639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the judges among the Hebrews</hi> <foreign />, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 3</bibl>. <cb n="CROC" /></sense></entryFree>
crithologia: <entryFree id="n11640" type="greek" key="cri_tho^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crīthŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kriqologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n11640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gathering of barley</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 27, 1</bibl>; Cod. Th. 14, 26, 1.</sense></entryFree>
crithote: <entryFree id="n11641" type="main" key="Cri_tho_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīthōtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kriqwth/</foreign>, <sense id="n11641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Chersonesus Thracia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
critias: <entryFree id="n11642" type="main" key="Cri^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĭtĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kriti/as</foreign>, <sense id="n11642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the thirty tyrants at Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
criticus: <entryFree id="n11643" type="greek" key="cri^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crĭtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kritiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suitable for deciding, capable of judging.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11643.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, only as a medic. t. t. (cf. crisimus), <hi rend="ital">decisive, critical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessio morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—More frequent, </sense><sense id="n11643.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crĭtĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a critic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 1</bibl> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 14</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crito: <entryFree id="n11644" type="main" key="Cri_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kri/twn</foreign>, <sense id="n11644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rich citizen of Athens, a disciple and friend of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:103 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 103 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11644.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian physician of Trajan's time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:60:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 60, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
critobulus: <entryFree id="n11645" type="main" key="Cri^to^bu_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĭtŏbūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11645.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disciple of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11645.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 57, 37, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
critognatus: <entryFree id="n11646" type="main" key="Critognatus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Critognatus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief of the Arverni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
critolaus: <entryFree id="n11647" type="main" key="Cri^to^la_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crĭtŏlāus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n11647.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A peripatetic philosopher, who was sent with Carneades and the Stoic Diogenes as an ambassador to Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 14, 9; 17, 21, 48; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11647.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leader of the Achaians, in a war with the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11647.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Sicilian at Henna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
criumetopon: <entryFree id="n11648" type="main" key="Cri_u_me^to_pon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crīūmĕtōpon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kriou= me/twpon</foreign> (Ramsbrow), <sense id="n11648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory at the southern extremity of the Tauric Chersonesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 23, 30, § 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">written as Greek,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11648.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory at the southwestern point of Crete</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cape Crio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">written as Greek,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crobylos: <entryFree id="n11649" type="greek" key="cro_by^lo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crōbylŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krw/bulos</foreign>, <sense id="n11649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a roll of hair knotted on the crown of the head</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocale: <entryFree id="n11650" type="main" key="Cro^ca^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏcălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocallis: <entryFree id="n11651" type="greek" key="crocallis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crocallis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown, cherryshaped precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocatio: <entryFree id="n11652" type="gloss" key="croca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crocātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crocio</etym>, <sense id="n11652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the croaking of ravens</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocatus: <entryFree id="n11653" type="main" key="cro^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crocus</etym>, <sense id="n11653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saffronyellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
croceus: <entryFree id="n11654" type="main" key="cro^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to saffron, saffron-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11654.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tinctus,</quote> <trans><tr>saffron-sauce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10, 59, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11654.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">saffron-colored, yellow, golden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acanthus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamys,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 775</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <trans><tr>a saffron-tint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:444" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 444</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crocias: <entryFree id="n11655" type="greek" key="cro^ci^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kroki/as</foreign>, <sense id="n11655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown, saffron-colored precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocidismus: <entryFree id="n11656" type="greek" key="cro^ci^dismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcĭdismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krokidismo/s</foreign>; of the sick, <sense id="n11656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a picking off of flocks</hi> (of wool, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:34" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:1:6:48" default="NO">1, 6, 48</bibl>; cf. carphologia.</sense></entryFree>
crocino: <entryFree id="n11657" type="main" key="cro^ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>crocum</etym>, <sense id="n11657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to anoint with saffron-ointment</hi>: jumenta, Gargil. Mart. de Cura Boum, p. 457 Bip.</sense></entryFree>
crocinus: <entryFree id="n11658" type="greek" key="cro^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kro/kinos</foreign>, <sense id="n11658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to saffron, saffron-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11658.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:19:73:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 73, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 173" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <trans><tr>saffron-colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11658.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. oleum), <hi rend="ital">saffron-oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 10, 22.—</sense><sense id="n11658.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The color of saffron, saffron-yellow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:78:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 78, § 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11658.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocio: <entryFree id="n11659" type="greek" key="cro_ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crōcĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">krw/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n11659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">croak as a raven</hi> [cf. glocio, clango], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 23, p. 366, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocis: <entryFree id="n11660" type="greek" key="cro^cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kroki/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocito: <entryFree id="n11661" type="main" key="cro^ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n11661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [crocio, with change of quantity], <hi rend="ital">to croak loudly</hi>: corvus, Auct. Philom. 28; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 123, 24</bibl>. <cb n="CROE" /></sense></entryFree>
crocitus: <entryFree id="n11662" type="main" key="cro_ci_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crōcītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crocio</etym>, <sense id="n11662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the croaking of the raven</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 45, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
croco: <entryFree id="n11663" type="main" key="cro^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n11663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to dye saffron-yellow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 11, 4</bibl>; cf. crocatus.</sense></entryFree>
crocodes: <entryFree id="n11664" type="gloss" key="cro^co_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krokw=des</foreign>, <sense id="n11664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (saffron-like) <hi rend="ital">eye-salve</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4233 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crocodilea: <entryFree id="n11665" type="greek" key="cro^co^di_le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcŏdīlĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krokodeile/a</foreign>, <sense id="n11665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the excrement of the crocodile</hi>, as a medicament, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 28, § 108</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 11</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
crocodilina: <entryFree id="n11666" type="greek" key="cro^co^di_li^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcŏdīlĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krokodeili/nh</foreign> (cf. Lidd. and Scott, under <foreign lang="greek">kroko/deilos</foreign>, II.; v. also ceratina), <sense id="n11666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sophism</hi> called <hi rend="ital">crocodile, a crocodile-conclusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocodilion: <entryFree id="n11667" type="greek" key="cro^co^di_li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcŏdīlĭon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lĕon</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krokodei/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n11667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, so called from the rough skin of its stalk, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 41, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocodilus: <entryFree id="n11668" type="greek" key="cro^co^di_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcŏdīlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kroko/deilos</foreign>, <sense id="n11668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crocodile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:89 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 89 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:107" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 28, § 107</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 52, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 29, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 13</bibl>.—In the metathesis <orth extent="full" lang="la">corcŏdīlus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 25, 4</bibl> and 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 7</bibl> Schneid.; cf. Ritschl in Rhein. Mus. vol. 9, p. 478 sq.</sense></entryFree>
crocofantia: <entryFree id="n11669" type="main" key="cro^co^fanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcŏfantĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">crŏcŭ-</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-phantĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <foreign lang="greek">[kro/kos, u(fai/nein]</foreign>, = crocota, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 10</bibl>.</entryFree>
crocomagma: <entryFree id="n11670" type="greek" key="cro^co^magma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcŏmagma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kroko/magma</foreign>, <sense id="n11670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the residuum of saffron, after the extraction of the oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 82, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crocos: <entryFree id="n11671" type="main" key="cro^co^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcŏs</orth>, v. crocus.</entryFree>
crocota: <entryFree id="n11672" type="greek" key="cro^co_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vestis), <foreign lang="greek">o( krokwto/s</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">xitw/n</foreign>), <sense id="n11672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saffron-colored court-dress</hi> (for women), Naev. and Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 548, 26 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> ib. 538, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 2</bibl>; Auct. Har. Resp. 21, 44; cf. crocotula.</sense></entryFree>
crocotarius: <entryFree id="n11673" type="hapax" key="cro^co_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcōtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crocota</etym>, <sense id="n11673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the preparation of saffron-colored garments</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infectores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crocotillum: <entryFree id="n11674" type="main" key="crocotillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crocotillum</orth>, <itype>valde exile</itype>, Plaut. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301:26 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301, 26 sq.</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n11674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (certainly corrupt).</sense></entryFree>
crocotinum: <entryFree id="n11675" type="gloss" key="crocotinum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crocotinum</orth> <itype>genus operis pistorii</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53, 5</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
crocotta: <entryFree id="n11676" type="foreign" key="cro^cotta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcotta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏrŏc-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown witd animal in Ethiopia</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the hyena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:107" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 30, 45, § 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocotula: <entryFree id="n11677" type="main" key="cro^co_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcōtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>crocota</etym>, <sense id="n11677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saffron-colored court-robe</hi> (for women), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 5, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crocum: <entryFree id="n11678" type="greek" key="cro^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n11678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 255, 30</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kro/kos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">saffron</hi>: Crocus sativus, Linn.; <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> usu. of the plant, <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> of the essence, etc., but the distinction is not closely observed. </sense><sense id="n11678.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Crocus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 182</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 399</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">plur. nom.</hi> croci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 393</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> crocos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:442" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 442</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:208" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11678.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Crocum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11678.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Gen. incert.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:342" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 342</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 318</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 23, 2</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:4 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 4 al.</bibl>—Frequently employed among the ancients, not only for the seasoning of food and in medicine, but transformed, by means of water and wine, to an essence, for the diffusion of a fragrant odor in theatres and other places; <cit><quote lang="la">for anointing the hair, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:25 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 25 al.</bibl>; cf. Cilix and Cilissa, under Cilicia.
